teal.sim.properties

Interface Stepping

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VectorGenerator, WaveGenerator

    public interface Stepping
    SimElements implementing the Stepping interface will have their nextStep() method called by the SimEngine at each frame of the simulation. In principle, this should only be used to handle independently evolving processes such as wave generators (ie. unrelated to the dynamic integration of the SimEngine).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isStepping()
      Returns whether or not this object is currently stepping.
      void nextStep(double dt)
      The stepped functionality of this object should be contained in nextStep().
      void reset()
      Resets whatever stepping process is occurning.
      void setStepping(boolean b)
      Sets whether this object is currently stepping.

    • Method Detail

        Sets whether this object is currently stepping.
        Parameters:

      • nextStep

        void nextStep(double dt)
        The stepped functionality of this object should be contained in nextStep(). This method is called by the SimEngine at each frame of a simulation.
        Parameters:
        dt - simulation time step

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets whatever stepping process is occurning.
